newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Aug 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Aug 18.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
PEOPLE'S DAILY
- China delays launch date of Philippine satellite.
- Number of domestic and foreign tourists visiting the Three Gorges increases sharply.
- Construction approved for 1,350 megawatt power station in southwestern Yunnan province.
- Output value of township enterprises in central China's Hunan Province surges 49.5 percent year-on-year in the first half.
FINANCIAL NEWS
- Assets of Everbright Bank of China reach 51.1 billion yuan at end-June
- China allocates 6.915 billion yuan at end-June for resettlement of people living near the Three Gorges dam project.
- Sales of Haier group hit 4.813 billion yuan in the first half, up 68.5 percent year-on-year
CHINA SECURITIES

- Dong Fureng, vice-chairman of the Finance and Economic Committee of the National People's Congress, says centralisation of stock markets will reduce interference by local authorities and other irregularities.
ECONOMIC DAILY
- China's private sector employed about 25 million people at end-June, up 1.7 million from the end of 1996.
- Fixed asset investment up 10.5 percent year-on-year in the first seven months of this year.
- Editorial says China needs more world-class conglomerates to boost its competitiveness.
PEOPLE'S DAILY OVERSEAS EDITION
- China can export about 600,000 tonnes of zinc this year, and domestic zinc prices seen rising to 115,000 yuan per tonne in 1997.
CHINA WOMEN'S NEWS
- China uncovered 39,015 drug cases between April and June, arresting 55,211 people.
LIBERATION ARMY DAILY
- Gymnastics champion Li Xiaoshuang will not attend world gymnastics tournament because of foot injury
XINHUA DAILY TELEGRAPH
- China's rural economy has been booming since the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China in 1992.
- State survey says cash income of farmers rose 3.3 percent year-on-year in the first half of 1997.
FARMER'S DAILY
- Corn output up by 200,000 tonnes this year from 1996
MARKET DAILY
- China distillery Qinchi group to form $6.0 million joint venture with Italian firm to produce wine.
CHINA BUSINESS TIMES
- China sees gold output at 122-130 tonnes for 1997.
ECONOMIC INFORMATION DAILY
- Daya Bay nuclear power station generates 6.774 billion kilowatt hours of electricity at end-July.
- China's car prices fall between one percent and 8.1 percent in the first half of this year.
CHINA DAILY
- Transport authorities improving poor maintenance of fast-growing highway network.
